alert.note: Alert for Middlesex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:25PM EST until December 21 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Sudbury River At Saxonville affecting Middlesex County. For the Sudbury River...including Saxonville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sudbury River at Saxonville. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding will affect portions of Shore and Pelham Island Roads as well as River Road in wayland. Flooding will also begin to impact Route 20 at Route 27. Other low lying areas along the river will experience flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 PM EST Monday was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.9 feet on 04/24/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at noon EST.
